title: Little Budworth Country Park Walking Route

images.title: David Kitching / Little Budworth Common
images.caption: Little Budworth Common. Lowland Heath is increasingly threatened and scarce. This country park shows how well it can be conserved and recovered from encroaching trees.

images.title: andy / Oulton Park
images.caption: Oulton Park. Part of the motor racing circuit at Oulton Park as viewed from Warwick Bridgeand looking towards Lodge Corner. The circuit hosts the British Touring Car Championship, British F3 and British Superbikes.

images.title: Peter Styles / Oulton Park, Autumn
images.caption: Oulton Park, Autumn. Autumn leaf colour in the early morning near the entrance to Oulton Park race-track

images.title: Peter I. Vardy, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Monument in Oulton Park. Dedicated to John Francis Egerton, and by Scott and Moffatt erected in 1846 or 1847

images.title: Mike Harris / Darley Hall, Little Budworth
images.caption: Darley Hall, Little Budworth. Set out in the open fields 1½ km south-east of the Little Budworth and more than 2 km from the nearest road, Darley Hall is an old moated manor that has gently declined to its present status as a dairy farm.

images.title: Peter I. Vardy, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Photograph of Church View and Old Hall Cottage, cottages in Little Budworth. The village is located just to the east of the park and makes for a pleasant stroll.

description: Explore woodland, lowland heath, ponds and boggy mires in this country park near Winsford. You can follow the Heathland Trail waymarked walk around the park which is mostly flat. The walk also takes you on to Oulton Park which has a large lake, Oulton Hall and Oulton racing track. You can continue your waterside walking by heading east into Winsford where there are more lakes and the River Weaver Way .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area you could head to the nearby village of Tarporley. The circular walk from the village visits some of the highlights of the area including Beeston Castle, the Shropshire Union Canal and the Sandstone Trail. Head a couple of miles north of the park and you could pick up the popular Whitegate Way. The shared cycling and walking trail follows a disused railway line north from Winsford to Cuddington. A car park and the old station can be found at the Winsford end. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cheshire Walks page.
